#Text=Nik & Eva Speakman
#Text=Nik Speakman ( born 7 December 1961 ) [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] and Eva Speakman ( born 30 April 1969 ) , [ 3 ] [ 4 ] known collectively as The Speakmans , are British therapists and life coaches .
#Text=Career

#Text=Nik Speakman started a finance company , Personal Money Management , aged 26 with his former partner and was working as a success coach at the time of his and Eva 's 2005 appearance in That 's Rich , a Granada Television series focusing on entrepreneurs in the north west of England . [ 5 ]
#Text=Eva Speakman ran the Heavenly Bodies gym in Oldham , at the time of the show . [ 5 ]
#Text=The Speakmans were subsequently hosts of a Living TV show , A Life Coach Less Ordinary , and in 2007 published a book , You Can Be Fantastic , Too ! . [ 6 ]
#Text=The couple hosted a television pilot for the American FOX network , Panic Attack , in 2010 . [ 7 ]
#Text=A second daytime television show , The Speakmans , was broadcast by ITV .
#Text=In The Speakmans they attempted to ' successfully treat ordinary people with extraordinary problems ' . [ 8 ]
#Text=The show aired for 20 episodes , beginning on 14 July 2014 . [ 9 ]
#Text=The Speakmans are regular columnists in ' Love It Magazine ' .
#Text=The couple regularly appears on ITV 's This Morning hosting a segment about anxiety issues and phobias .
#Text=The Speakmans use ' schema conditioning psychotherapy ' to ' find and tackle the root cause of anxiety disorders ' . [ 10 ]
#Text=Nik Speakman said of their approach on their television series that " We 're really hoping people will look at it and think : ' I can apply that to my life . '

#Text=The Speakmans also believe in  practising gratitude " , asserting that " Everybody ’s got problems and issues but equally everybody has got amazing things to be thankful for . " [ 10 ]

column1: #Text=Therapeutic techniques utilized by the couple include putting clients into a DeLorean sports car in order to ' travel ' back to the future ' to confront past demons ' , a reference to the DeLorean time machine from the Back to the Future film series . [ 2 ]
#Text=The Speakmans presented a DeLorean car to the former Liberal Member of Parliament for Rochdale , Sir Cyril Smith , at his 80th birthday party in 2008 . [ 11 ]
#Text=Noted celebrity clients of the Speakmans have included Peter Andre , Kerry Katona , Kym Marsh , Liz McClarnon , Katie Price , Holly Willoughby and Jeremy Kyle . [ 2 ] [ 10 ] [ 12 ]
#Text=The Speakmans have diplomas in an unspecified subject from Newcastle University , [ 4 ] but are not accredited psychotherapists .
#Text=In December 2015 , The Speakmans appeared on BBC Radio 2 's Breakfast Show with Sara Cox [ 13 ]
#Text=Personal life
#Text=The Speakmans have lived in Littleborough near Rochdale in Greater Manchester since 2000 . [ 14 ] [ 10 ]
#Text=The Speakmans converted their house from a former pub and restaurant into a nine-bedroomed house . [ 2 ]

#Text=The couple put their house up for sale in 2010 as they worked on the Panic Attack pilot in the United States , and planned to move to the south of England owing to their work in London and America . [ 2 ]

#Text=The couple have two children , Olivia and Hunter , and are supporters of a local children 's home , the Duke Bar Burnley Wood NCH Children 's Centre [ 15 ] , and are Celebrity Ambassadors of Variety Children 's Charity . [ 16 ]
#Text=Awards
#Text=In October 2017 , the Speakmans were awarded a Legends of Industry Award for their contribution to the Therapeutic/Motivational Industry . [ 17 ]
